resources.string: Mets, also known as Metabolic Equivalents, is used to assign a numeric value to different activities and help to visualize how different activities are categorized. For example, 1 MET would be your metabolism at rest. 2 METs would be double your resting metabolism. 3 METs would be triple your resting metabolism.

Hours: Monday:6:00am-7:20am; 8:30am-4:30pm; 4:30pm-6:30pm (1 lane); 7:30pm-9:00pm. Tuesday\Thursday:6:00am-7:20am; 8:30am-4:30pm; 4:30pm-5:00pm (1 lane); 7:30pm-9:00pm. Wednesday:6:00am-7:20am; 8:30am-4:30pm; 4:30pm-6:30pm (1 lane); 6:30pm-9:00pm. Friday:6:00am-7:20am; 8:30am-8:30pm. Saturday:9:00am-8:30pm. Sunday:9:00am-9:00pm.

Indoor climbing wall offers students top-rope, traversing, and bouldering chances.First visit of each semester is free; an unlimited semester pass can then be purchased for $15. Hours: Monday-Thursday:2:00pm-10:00pm. Friday and Sunday:2:00pm-6:00pm. Saturday:CLOSED (Available for Group Rentals).
Back extension is used for strengthening the lower back (mostly erector spinae). It is done by using a back extension machine where body pushes a weight backwards. Try 3 sets of 5 exercises.

The Back Fly Machine involves grasping two handles at shoulder height, and pushing them together while keeping the elbows at a constant angle. It is used to work the muscles of the upper body, primarily the sternal head of the pectoralis major.
The Bicep Curl Machine is used for strengthening the biceps. It involves a weight moving through an arc, primarily using the strength of the biceps.

The Chest Press focuses on the development of the pectoralis major muscle as well as other supporting muscles including the anterior deltoids, serratus anterior, coracobrachialis, scapulae fixers, trapezii, and the triceps. The person lowers a weight to the level of the chest, then pushes it back up until the arm is straight.
An Incline Press elevates the shoulders and lowers the pelvis as if reclining in a chair; It emphasizes anterior deltoids and emphasizes the upper (clavicular head) of the pectoralis major.

The Lat Pulldown is designed to develop the latissimus dorsi muscle. It is done where the handle is moved via a cable pulley. It requires dynamic work by muscles surrounding the three joints which move during the exercise. These are the elbow in conjunction with the glenohumeral and scapulothoracic joints in the shoulder girdle.
The Leg Extension a resistance weight training exercise that targets the quadriceps muscle in the legs. It should not be considered as a total leg workout.

The Pec Fly primarily works the pectoralis major muscles to move the arms horizontally forward. The hands are usually brought out further than the elbows, in which case the flexors contract isometrically to inhibit undesired excess flexion of the elbow.

The Rotary Chest Press primarily works the pectoralis major and secondarily works the triceps. Press handles forward till arms are fully extended. Return to starting position without letting weights touch the stack and perform upward motion again.
The Rotary Lat Pulldown functions very similarly to the Lat Pulldown machine, but provides a greater focus on the shoulders in addition to the back.

The Rotary Seated Row is an exercise where the purpose is to strengthen the muscles that draw the rower\'s arms toward the body (latissimus dorsi) as well as those that retract the scapulae (trapezius and rhomboids) and those that support the spine (erector spinae).
The Rotary Shoulder Press is performed by a weight pressing straight upwards from the shoulders until it is locked out overhead.
The Seated Leg Curl is an isolation exercise that targets the hamstring muscles. The exercise involves flexing the lower leg against resistance towards the buttocks.

The Seated Row is an exercise where the purpose is to strengthen the muscles that draw the rower\'s arms toward the body (latissimus dorsi) as well as those that retract the scapulae (trapezius and rhomboids) and those that support the spine (erector spinae).
The Tricep Extension works the triceps from the elbow all the way to the latissimus dorsi. It is one of the most stimulating exercises to the entire triceps muscle group in the upper arm.

This section of the Rec Center is the free weights section. Here, one can perform a wide variety of exercises using dumbells, barbells, or exercises using plates. Further information about the large variety of exercises can be learned from personal trainers that can be found at the Rec.
An elliptical is a stationary exercise machine used to simulate stair climbing, walking, or running without causing excessive pressure to the joints, hence decreasing the risk of impact injuries.
An erg, or rowing machine, is a machine used to simulate the action of watercraft rowing for the purpose of exercise or training for rowing.

The leg press is a weight training exercise in which the individual pushes a weight or resistance away from them using their legs. The user sits upright and pushes forward with their feet onto a plate that is attached to the weight stack by means of a long steel cable.

The Rotary Incline Chest Press primarily works the pectoralis major and secondarily works the triceps and deltoids. Press handles forward till arms are fully extended. Return to starting position without letting weights touch the stack and perform upward motion again.
The Shoulder Press is performed by a weight pressing straight upwards from the shoulders until it is locked out overhead.
The Abdominal Machine focuses on the abdominal muscles, and is used in a similar fashion as to how one does crunches.

Exercise bikes are used for exercise, to increase general fitness, and for training for cycle events. The exercise bike has long been used for physical therapy because of the low-impact, safe, and effective cardiovascular exercise it provides.
A treadmill is a device for walking or running while staying in the same place.
The Hip Abductor machine is used to strengthen the muscles of the outer thighs.
The Hip Adductor is used to strengthen the muscles of the inner thighs.
An elliptical is a stationary exercise machine used to simulate stair climbing, walking, or running without causing excessive pressure to the joints, hence decreasing the risk of impact injuries.>
